TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IKeyManager

Docs.summary: The basic interface for performing key management operations.
Docs.remarks: Instantiations of this interface are expected to be thread-safe.

Docs.param: The date on which encryptions to this key may begin.
The date after which encryptions to this key may no longer take place.
Docs.summary: Creates a new key with the specified activation and expiration dates and persists the new key to the underlying repository.

Docs.summary: Fetches all keys from the underlying repository.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.CancellationToken GetCacheExpirationToken ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken GetCacheExpirationToken() cil managed
Public Function GetCacheExpirationToken () As CancellationToken
abstract member GetCacheExpirationToken : unit -> System.Threading.CancellationToken
public: System::Threading::CancellationToken GetCacheExpirationToken();

Docs.summary: Retrieves a token that signals that callers who have cached the return value of GetAllKeys should clear their caches. This could be in response to a call to CreateNewKey or RevokeKey, or it could be in response to some other external notification. Callers who are interested in observing this token should call this method before the corresponding call to GetAllKeys.
Docs.returns: The cache expiration token. When an expiration notification is triggered, any tokens previously returned by this method will become canceled, and tokens returned by future invocations of this method will themselves not trigger until the next expiration event.
Docs.remarks: Implementations are free to return 'CancellationToken.None' from this method. Since this token is never guaranteed to fire, callers should still manually clear their caches at a regular interval.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RevokeAllKeys (DateTimeOffset revocationDate, string reason = null);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RevokeAllKeys(valuetype System.DateTimeOffset revocationDate, string reason) cil managed
Public Sub RevokeAllKeys (revocationDate As DateTimeOffset, Optional reason As String = null)
abstract member RevokeAllKeys : DateTimeOffset * string -> unit

Docs.param: The revocation date. All keys with a creation date before this value will be revoked.
An optional human-readable reason for revocation.
Docs.summary: Revokes all keys created before a specified date and persists the revocation to the underlying repository.
Docs.remarks: This method will not mutate existing IKey instances. After calling this method, all existing IKey instances should be discarded, and GetAllKeys should be called again.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RevokeKey (Guid keyId, string reason = null);

Public Sub RevokeKey (keyId As Guid, Optional reason As String = null)
abstract member RevokeKey : Guid * string -> unit

Docs.param: The id of the key to revoke.
An optional human-readable reason for revocation.
Docs.summary: Revokes a specific key and persists the revocation to the underlying repository.
Docs.remarks: This method will not mutate existing IKey instances. After calling this method, all existing IKey instances should be discarded, and GetAllKeys should be called again.
